Detailed Description

Runs a round-robin tournament between a set of players.

This class is responsible for running a round-robin tournament between a set of players it receives using the wxEVT_ADD_PLAYER event.

Every time a player is added (see the AddPlayer method), two new copies of it are created (see Player::Clone) and added to the playerOneList and playerTwoList. The tournament is then set up by creating a match for each combination of the elements in this list.

The individual matches are then run, and the scores are accumulated in the scores member, which can be queried to determine the results.

Member Typedef Documentation

Member Function Documentation

void Tournament::AddPlayer ( const Player *  player  ) 

Add a player to the internal list.

This function is intended to be called in response to the wxEVT_ADD_PLAYER event. The player passed will be copied twice, and the copies stored on the two player lists.

This function will not store the pointer passed to it.

Parameters:
player Player to be cloned and added to the tournament
Match* Tournament::GetMatch ( int  idx  ) 

Get a given match from the matches array.

Note:
This function is not bounds-checked, make sure that idx is less than GetNumMatches().
Parameters:
idx The index of the match to be returned
int Tournament::GetNumMatches (  )  const

Get the number of matches played.

int Tournament::GetNumPlayers (  )  const

Get the number of players in the tournament.

bool Tournament::IsPlayed (  )  const

Has the tournament been played?

void Tournament::RecalculateMatchList (  )  [private]

Recompute the list of matches.

Calculates the round-robin match list, with one match between each pair of players. See the matches member.

void Tournament::RemovePlayer ( const Player *  player  ) 

Remove a player like this from the internal list.

This function will search the player lists for a player of the same type, name, and author as the one passed, and remove any players which match. Notably, this means that all sorts of unspecified bugs will occur if two players of the same type, name, and author are added to the tournament.

This function will not store the pointer passed to it.

Parameters:
player Player of the same type, name, and author as those to be removed
void Tournament::Reset (  ) 

Reset all internal data.

This clears all scores and matches, preparing to run another tournament using the same player lists.

bool Tournament::Run (  ) 

Run the tournament.

Run the actual matches in the tournament, accumulating the player scores into the scores member.

Returns:
True if the tournament ran successfully, false otherwise
